summary: This document excerpt from a news article details how Jeffrey Epstein connected a Russian model with Terje Rød-Larsen of the International Peace Institute (IPI), promising her UN-related work opportunities. It describes Epstein's use of these connections to facilitate travel and his request for women to pose with famous men like Bill Gates. The article also notes Rød-Larsen's resignation in 2020 after disclosing financial ties to Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Connected a Russian model with Terje Rød-Larsen, promised her modeling/acting jobs and UN work, facilitated her travel to Norway, and asked women to pose with famous men.

persons.name: Terje Rød-Larsen
persons.role: Former head of the International Peace Institute (IPI)
persons.context: Invited the Russian model to Norway via email in 2013, which she used to obtain a visa to travel with Epstein. Resigned from IPI in 2020 after disclosing he took donations and a personal loan from Epstein.

persons.name: Bill Gates
persons.context: Appears in three photos with the Russian model at different locations, including a Four Seasons Hotel in New York and Epstein's townhouse, as part of Epstein's request for women to pose with famous men.

connections.description: Rød-Larsen took donations and a personal loan from Epstein, as disclosed in 2020, indicating a financial connection.
Epstein connected the Russian model with Rød-Larsen for potential UN-related work opportunities through the International Peace Institute.
Epstein asked women, including the Russian model, to pose with Gates and post pictures on social media, suggesting a social connection Epstein sought to display.

events.title: Email to mother about IPI opportunity
events.description: The Russian model emailed her mother in Russia, stating Jeffrey Epstein said IPI people loved her and she was waiting to hear back from their lawyers regarding a work opportunity.

events.title: Email invitation to Norway
events.description: Terje Rød-Larsen emailed the Russian model inviting her to Norway, which she used to obtain a visa to travel there with Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Travel to Kazakhstan with IPI team
events.description: The Russian model accompanied an IPI team to Kazakhstan, but a promised job never materialized.

events.title: Rød-Larsen resigns from IPI
events.description: Terje Rød-Larsen resigned from the International Peace Institute after disclosing he had taken donations and a personal loan from Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: Four Seasons Hotel in New York
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein connected a Russian model with Terje Rød-Larsen of the International Peace Institute (IPI), promising her UN-related work opportunities that never materialized.
Epstein used an email invitation from Rød-Larsen in 2013 to facilitate the model's travel to Norway with him.
Terje Rød-Larsen resigned from IPI in 2020 after disclosing financial ties to Epstein, including donations and a personal loan.

Epstein asked the Russian model and other women to pose with famous men like Bill Gates and post the pictures on social media; photos were reviewed of her with Gates at Epstein's townhouse and a Four Seasons Hotel.
